results.title: The Brave little toaster
results.brief_description: Let the brave little Toaster carry you away on an electrifying ride you will never forget. There’s laughs, there’s songs, there’s suspense and plenty of adventure as the little Toaster and his friends, the Vacuum Cleaner, the Clock Radio, the Electric Blanket and the Desk Lamp set off to find their young master after he mysteriously disappears. Breathtaking animation ensures this acclaimed tale of loyalty and courage is sure to brighten spirits and entertain for a long time to come. Based on the novel by Thomas M. Disch.

results.title: The brasses
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Instruments of the band and orchestra”.
Explains the contribution of the brass section in bands and orchestras. Explains the principle of sound production in the brass instruments. Includes demonstrations of the trumpet, cornet, french horn, trombone, baritone and tuba.

results.title: The Brass choir: an instructional sound film
results.brief_description: A fine and artfully “composed” documentary film of the orchestra in performance. Shows a sensitive demonstration of the tone color of instruments from the orchestra’s brass section with excerpts from Beethoven’s 5th Symphony, the Nocturne from Mendelson’s Midsummer Night’s Dream, Wagner’s Tannhauser.

results.title: The Brain that wouldn't die
results.creator_credit: Joseph Green, Rex Carlton, Mort Landberg and Rex Carlton Productions
results.brief_description: After a car crash, a man keeps his wife’s head alive in his laboratory. As if this weren’t enough, an evil beast pounds and screams from a locked room adjacent to the lab, for some reason the film ends with the title “The Head that Wouldn’t Die” instead of “The Brain that Wouldn’t Die.” Cast includes Jason Evers (Dr. Bill Cortner, as Herb Evers), Virginia Leith (Jan Compton), Leslie Daniels (Kurt), Adele Lamont (Doris Powell), Bonnie Sharie (Blonde Stripper), Paula Maurice (Brunette Stripper), Marilyn Hanold (Peggy Howard) and Bruce Brighton (Dr. Cortner).

results.title: The Brain Puzzle (TEFC)
results.brief_description: The ability of the brain to physically alter in response to external events accounts for the partial recovery of stroke and head injury victims. This program looks at the possibility for the brain to speed up these recovery processes.
results.description: The ability of the brain to physically alter in response to external events accounts for the partial recovery of stroke and head injury victims. This program looks at the possibility for the brain to speed up these recovery processes.

results.title: The Brain eaters
results.creator_credit: Bruno VeSota, Edwin Nelson and American International Pictures (AIP)
results.brief_description: Crawling, slimy things terror-bent on destroying the world! So runs the tagline for “The Brain eaters”, classic B-grade science fiction about a mysterious alien structure found jutting out of the earth, in small-town USA. After some studious investigating, a senator and a doctor discover that aliens have infiltrated and are controlling the townsfolk. The terror of a mind-controlling alien threat and subsequent loss of governmental power operates as an analogy for the fear of Communist invasion and the accusations of brainwashing that were likened to the “Red threat”.

results.title: The Brain and behavior
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Psychology”.
Demonstrates two ways in which the function of different brain areas can be studied. One method is to stimulate different parts of the living brain with an electrode. The other is to measure the changes in behaviour following injuries to different areas of the brain.

results.title: The Brain-mind connection
results.creator_credit: Steven Talley and Coastlaine Community College
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Psychology: the study of human behavior”.
What is the brain? What does it do? The structure of this most complex of living organisms is described and illustrated by case studies of people who have suffered damage to specific areas of the brain. Their cases also illustrate the immense plasticity and adaptability of the brain. Appropriate training can actually stimulate the brain to restore functions lost, either by damage or by aging, by transferring them to other parts of the brain.

results.title: The Bradman era
results.creator_credit: Jack Egan, Albie Thoms and ABC Video
results.brief_description: This film, a companion to the book, traces the career of Sir Donald Bradman from the early 1930s through until 1948 when he led an undefeated Australian team in England in his last test series. The film also contains coverage of many of the controversial incidents during the “Bodyline” series in 1932-33 and shows the great players in action. Rated: G
